ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Think back to before you attended treatment, when you were using drugs at your heaviest level. How much do you agree or disagree that using alcohol or other drugs helped you to feel less shy and make friends
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Think back to before you attended treatment, when you were using drugs at your heaviest level. How much do you agree or disagree that using alcohol or other drugs helped you to be like other teenagers.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Think back to before you attended treatment, when you were using drugs at your heaviest level. How much do you agree or disagree that using alcohol or other drugs helped you to feel more comfortable around someone of the opposite sex.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree
